title: NIXON | RIFFE: Professional Spearfisherman Ryder DeVoe
description:
To celebrate our new Riffe Digi-Tek Camo Collection, we went exploring around San Clemente Island off the coast of California with spear-fisherman Ryder DeVoe. Sitting 56 miles off the San Diego coast with limited access under its status as a military test site, San Clemente Island has some of the most diverse and untouched terrain in Southern California. Exploring the picturesque kelp forests off the island, Ryder explains his introduction to spearfishing, techniques used in the sport and what drives him in this unique endeavor. 

A natural extension of the inspiration behind the Riffe Digi-Tek Camo collection, a collaborative capsule that introduces a first-of-its-kind pattern to three of our most popular watermen models: The Lodown Silicone, The Unit Dive and The Super Unit. The watches are all finished in Riffe’s signature Digi-Tek camouflage adding greater function – and impact - both in and out of the water. And much like the colors of the ocean, the the patterns of the Riffe Digi-Tek camo vary based on where it is placed on the watch, making each timepiece unique.

See more at online.nixon.com/us/en/happenings
asset.author: Nixon

transcripts: When I walk down the dock in the morning I have thought of the perfect scenario and I just have to keep it under control and not get too excited because it doesn't happen everyday it's a rare occurrence but you always just have to put your time in. You're always hoping you're going to get a fish but a lot of it is just driving and getting your technique better and just hoping that the school swims by, but if not you're having a great day on the water it’s better than being in an office. There's never a dull moment there’s always the next thing and the next big fish to hunt or the next big wave to surf in. I just feel like there's never like you can never master it there's always more you know, you got to expect the unexpected you never know what's going to swim up or what's going to happen. There's a lot of timing involved when making a dive and coming up of a dive and I have all these certain rests that I have set in my head for a certain amount of time and when I do them you want to make sure everything is accurate. A lot of times you're just cruising the kelp or blue water I mean it's just nice to be in the ocean you know just even if you don't shoot a fish it’s just always good. Kelp diving is pretty special to me because it's in my backyard and one of the days I went out there it was 80 to 100 foot. The kelp was like super big that time of year and it was just this kind of like a the whole like tiny human, huge environment like you dive down to like 80 feet and you look up and there’s this giant underwater forest around you with bait and sea lions and it’s just pretty amazing. I feel like passion drives success if you're super into something no matter what people say to you like oh you're wasting your time blah,blah, blah, if you feel like this is a good opportunity for you, if you feel like this is a good direction to go and you're super into it I feel like you should just keep going and keep going and you've got to make sure you're on track like you could get all your work done and have the most fun in the world surfing or diving or fishing or boating whatever it is I mean I feel like why would you stop you know. My name is Ryder DeVoe I'm 17 and from Encinitas, California and spear fish.
